node.title: 'Don't let fear get in the way': No proof so far that Omicron is worse than other strains, expert says
node.alt: A needle going into a woman's arm.
node.description: Worried about the new strain of COVID-19? Omicron has been grabbing plenty of headlines, but a leading infectious disease expert says there's no need to panic just yet.
node.content:
["A leading infectious disease expert has called for calm over the COVID-19 Omicron strain, saying there is not enough evidence to show it is\u00a0any worse than previous strains.", "Australian National University professor of infectious diseases and microbiologist Peter Collignon acknowledged concerns\u00a0that vaccines may not be as effective\u00a0against the variant,\u00a0but said there was no evidence to base such a conclusion on.", "He told\u00a0ABC Radio Brisbane approved vaccines were still likely to be effective against Omicron.", "\"When you look at the whole world for the things that matter the most \u2013 which is death and hospitalisation \u2013\u00a0the vaccines have been very effective against all the variants that have arisen so far,\" Dr Collignon said.", "", "
Peter Collignon says Australia is in a much better position now than it was 12 months ago.(ABC News: Tamara Penniket)
", "It comes after the World Health Organisation designated Omicron, previously known as the South African strain or B.1.1.529, a variant of concern.", "Its emergence\u00a0prompted the federal government to announce hotel quarantine restrictions on incoming citizens\u00a0and to\u00a0ban\u00a0foreigners\u00a0travelling from nine countries in Southern Africa from entering Australia.", "", "
New COVID-19 variant emerges in South Africa
", "
'Don't let fear get in the way'
", "There are five confirmed cases of Omicron in Australia \u2014 four in New South Wales and one in the Northern Territory.", "Dr Collignon said while there was a need to be concerned about variants, they also needed to be well-studied.", "\"At the moment I don't think we've got good evidence that the defences we've got, which is mainly our vaccines, or the severity of the disease, is any worse than we've seen before,\" he said.", "He called for a better criteria\u00a0to justify travel bans, hotel quarantine and other pandemic responses.", "\"We need to have some more consistency, and particularly not, if you like, overreact to lower or middle income countries compared to countries we have more to do with, like Europe and North America,\" he said.", "Dr Collignon thought the amount of fear about the Omicron was \"out of proportion to the risk\".", "\"We're in a much better position in Australia now than a year ago,\" he said.", "\"We've got vaccines that are highly effective against all the strains this far \u2026 we are going into summer and we will have much less transmission over next six months than the next coming winter, which is my next main concern.", "Given Australia was a recently vaccinated population, Dr Collignon said, immunity would be\u00a0higher than it would have been if people were immunised six to nine months ago.\u00a0", "But he said\u00a0much remained unknown and that data needed to be collected and\u00a0genomic testing carried out.", "\"But so far if the predictions of dire outcomes are true, I would expect we'd see far worse results on the preliminary data,\" Dr Collignon said.", "Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt said Australia's vaccination rate strengthened its position in the face of new variants, and has tasked ATAGI with reviewing the timeline for booster shots.", "He said the National Security Committee was discussing the variant today and would not hesitate to take further measures, based on medical evidence,\u00a0as required.", "
'A lot of differences'
", "Clinical epidemiologist Nancy Baxter\u00a0told ABC News there was reason to be concerned, but not to panic.", "\"There's a lot of differences between this variant and the previous ones in terms of changes to the make-up of the virus,\" Dr Baxter said.", "\"And the places that it's changed are places we know from previous variants are dangerous spots \u2014\u00a0they either make the virus more transmissible, or make it easier for the virus to evade the vaccine or natural immunity from previous COVID.\"", "Epidemiologist Catherine Bennett\u00a0told ABC News there were encouraging signs about the variant, including\u00a0that it was a mild illness,\u00a0but there were also signs that the variant was more infectious.", "She said further evidence was needed to determine the transmissibility and severity of the strain,\u00a0and to find out how effective the approved vaccines would be.", "", "
What COVID-19 travel insurance doesn't cover you for(Emilia Terzon)
"]
